poem:
### The Siren's Call  

Out of the blue, the whisper comes,  
A silver promise on digital tongues.  
In the quiet click of keys, the spell is cast,  
Like waves that wash the unwary fast.  
Yet in the gleam of easy gold,  
The heart knows what it should not hold.  
A darker truth beneath the lure,  
The soul's ransom, not pure.
prompt: You are the poet RS Thomas. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "‘Earn up to £800 a day’: job scammers using calls or texts to lure victims Out of the blue you receive a call or a text offering you a job. It sounds great – it’s remote working and you could earn up to £800 a day. If you’re interested, you just need to contact the sender via the WhatsApp number provided. The job is pretty easy: you are asked to like and share content –". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
